customer_addr:
5800 Lake Bluff Road
North Rose, NY 14516

citations.narrative:
Food storage must be addressed in multiple areas:
In Building B1, 2 unopened bags of dry dog food were stored on a broken wooden pallet immediately adjacent to a sand
bed for waste beneath an occupied enclosure, leading to an accumulation of fur, dust, and debris on the bags. A third bag
was previously opened but kept closed with a clip rather than a tightly fitted lid. Improper storage may cause
contamination, accelerate spoilage, and promote pests. These items were corrected at the time of inspection; all food
supplies must continue to be stored in a manner that minimizes these hazards.
In Building B2, the food receptacles in 6 empty enclosures contained molded dry food due to an automated feeder
malfunction. While the enclosures were not being used and no dogs were offered contaminated food, the continued
presence of molded food in animal areas may further promote pests and poor housekeeping. This was corrected at the
time of inspection; the facility must continue to ensure only food that is being used is kept in animal areas.
Correct by August 16, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
This facility was inspected over a two day period from August 14-15, 2024.
Additional Inspectors:
Jason Sifkarovski, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
KERI LUPO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Food storage must be addressed in multiple areas:  
In Building B1, 2 unopened bags of dry dog food were stored on a broken wooden pallet immediately adjacent to a sand 
bed for waste beneath an occupied enclosure, leading to an accumulation of fur, dust, and debris on the bags. A third bag 
was previously opened but kept closed with a clip rather than a tightly fitted lid. Improper storage may cause 
contamination, accelerate spoilage, and promote pests. These items were corrected at the time of inspection; all food 
supplies must continue to be stored in a manner that minimizes these hazards.  
 
In Building B2, the food receptacles in 6 empty enclosures contained molded dry food due to an automated feeder 
malfunction. While the enclosures were not being used and no dogs were offered contaminated food, the continued 
presence of molded food in animal areas may further promote pests and poor housekeeping. This was corrected at the 
time of inspection; the facility must continue to ensure only food that is being used is kept in animal areas.  
 
Correct by August 16, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
This facility was inspected over a two day period from August 14-15, 2024.
